trans-unit.source: Troubleshooting and Questions about Application Insights
trans-unit.target: Troubleshooting and Questions about Application Insights

trans-unit.source: Something in Visual Studio Application Insights unclear or not working? Try here.
trans-unit.target: Something in Visual Studio Application Insights unclear or not working? Try here.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>See Platforms[platforms]</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>See Platforms[platforms]</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: Yes, if you choose the free <linkText>pricing tier</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: Yes, if you choose the free <linkText>pricing tier</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: You get most features and a generous quota of data.
trans-unit.target: You get most features and a generous quota of data.

trans-unit.source: You have to provide your credit card data to register with Microsoft Azure, but no charges will be made unless you use another paid-for Azure service, or you explicitly upgrade to a paying tier.
trans-unit.target: You have to provide your credit card data to register with Microsoft Azure, but no charges will be made unless you use another paid-for Azure service, or you explicitly upgrade to a paying tier.

trans-unit.source: If your app sends more data than the monthly quota for the free tier, it stops being logged.
trans-unit.target: If your app sends more data than the monthly quota for the free tier, it stops being logged.

trans-unit.source: If that happens, you can either choose to start paying, or wait until the quota is reset at the end of the month.
trans-unit.target: If that happens, you can either choose to start paying, or wait until the quota is reset at the end of the month.

trans-unit.source: Basic usage and session data is not subject to a quota.
trans-unit.target: Basic usage and session data is not subject to a quota.

trans-unit.source: There is also a free 30-day trial, during which you get the Premium features free of charge.
trans-unit.target: There is also a free 30-day trial, during which you get the Premium features free of charge.

trans-unit.source: Each application resource has a separate quota, and you set its pricing tier independently of any others.
trans-unit.target: Each application resource has a separate quota, and you set its pricing tier independently of any others.

trans-unit.source: A larger <linkText>monthly quota of data</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: A larger <linkText>monthly quota of data</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Option to pay 'overage' to continue collecting data over the monthly quota.
trans-unit.target: Option to pay 'overage' to continue collecting data over the monthly quota.

trans-unit.source: If your data goes over quota, you're charged per Mb.
trans-unit.target: If your data goes over quota, you're charged per Mb.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Continuous export</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Continuous export</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Make sure you have <linkText>Visual Studio 2013 Update 3 or later</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: Make sure you have <linkText>Visual Studio 2013 Update 3 or later</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: It comes pre-installed with Application Insights Tools.
trans-unit.target: It comes pre-installed with Application Insights Tools.

trans-unit.source: Although the tools don't support all types of applications, you can probably still add an Application Insights SDK to your project manually.
trans-unit.target: Although the tools don't support all types of applications, you can probably still add an Application Insights SDK to your project manually.

trans-unit.source: Use <linkText>this procedure[windows]</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: Use <linkText>this procedure[windows]</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: This can happen if:
trans-unit.target: This can happen if:

trans-unit.source: Communication with the Application Insights portal failed; or
trans-unit.target: Communication with the Application Insights portal failed; or

trans-unit.source: There is some problem with your account;
trans-unit.target: There is some problem with your account;

trans-unit.source: You only have <linkText>read access to the subscription or group where you were trying to create the new resource</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: You only have <linkText>read access to the subscription or group where you were trying to create the new resource</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Remedy:
trans-unit.target: Remedy:

trans-unit.source: Check that you provided login credentials for the right Azure account.
trans-unit.target: Check that you provided login credentials for the right Azure account.

trans-unit.source: In some early versions of the tools, the Microsoft Azure credentials, which you see in the New Project dialog, can be different from the Visual Studio Online credentials that you see at the top right of Visual Studio.
trans-unit.target: In some early versions of the tools, the Microsoft Azure credentials, which you see in the New Project dialog, can be different from the Visual Studio Online credentials that you see at the top right of Visual Studio.

trans-unit.source: In your browser, check that you have access to the <linkText>Azure portal</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: In your browser, check that you have access to the <linkText>Azure portal</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Open Settings and see if there is any restriction.
trans-unit.target: Open Settings and see if there is any restriction.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add Application Insights to your existing project[start]</linkText><title></title>: In Solution Explorer, right click your project and choose "Add Application Insights."
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add Application Insights to your existing project[start]</linkText><title></title>: In Solution Explorer, right click your project and choose "Add Application Insights."

trans-unit.source: If it still isn't working, follow the <linkText>manual procedure</linkText><title></title> to add a resource in the portal and then add the SDK to your project.
trans-unit.target: If it still isn't working, follow the <linkText>manual procedure</linkText><title></title> to add a resource in the portal and then add the SDK to your project.

trans-unit.source: Looks like something went wrong while you were installing Application Insights or maybe a logging adapter.
trans-unit.target: Looks like something went wrong while you were installing Application Insights or maybe a logging adapter.

trans-unit.source: In Solution Explorer, right-click ApplicationInsights.config and choose Update Application Insights.
trans-unit.target: In Solution Explorer, right-click ApplicationInsights.config and choose Update Application Insights.

trans-unit.source: You'll get a dialog that invites you to sign in to Azure and either create an Application Insights resource, or re-use an existing one.
trans-unit.target: You'll get a dialog that invites you to sign in to Azure and either create an Application Insights resource, or re-use an existing one.

trans-unit.source: The details depend on the type of project.
trans-unit.target: The details depend on the type of project.

trans-unit.source: For a web application:
trans-unit.target: For a web application:

trans-unit.source: Adds these files to your project:
trans-unit.target: Adds these files to your project:

trans-unit.source: ApplicationInsights.config.
trans-unit.target: ApplicationInsights.config.

trans-unit.source: ai.js
trans-unit.target: ai.js

trans-unit.source: Installs these NuGet packages:
trans-unit.target: Installs these NuGet packages:

trans-unit.source: Application Insights API - the core API
trans-unit.target: Application Insights API - the core API

trans-unit.source: Application Insights API for Web Applications - used to send telemetry from the server
trans-unit.target: Application Insights API for Web Applications - used to send telemetry from the server

trans-unit.source: Application Insights API for JavaScript Applications - used to send telemetry from the client
trans-unit.target: Application Insights API for JavaScript Applications - used to send telemetry from the client

trans-unit.source: The packages include these assemblies:
trans-unit.target: The packages include these assemblies:

trans-unit.source: Microsoft.ApplicationInsights
trans-unit.target: Microsoft.ApplicationInsights

trans-unit.source: Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.Platform
trans-unit.target: Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.Platform

trans-unit.source: Inserts items into:
trans-unit.target: Inserts items into:

trans-unit.source: Web.config
trans-unit.target: Web.config

trans-unit.source: packages.config
trans-unit.target: packages.config

trans-unit.source: (New projects only - if you <linkText>add Application Insights to an existing project[start]</linkText><title></title>, you have to do this manually.)
trans-unit.target: (New projects only - if you <linkText>add Application Insights to an existing project[start]</linkText><title></title>, you have to do this manually.)

trans-unit.source: Inserts snippets into the client and server code to initialize them with the Application Insights resource ID.
trans-unit.target: Inserts snippets into the client and server code to initialize them with the Application Insights resource ID.

trans-unit.source: For example, in an MVC app, code is inserted into the master page Views/Shared/_Layout.cshtml
trans-unit.target: For example, in an MVC app, code is inserted into the master page Views/Shared/_Layout.cshtml

trans-unit.source: Please see <linkText>NuGet Package Restore</linkText><title></title> and <linkText>Automatic Package Restore</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: Please see <linkText>NuGet Package Restore</linkText><title></title> and <linkText>Automatic Package Restore</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: If you see the error above after updating to the 0.17 or newer NuGet packages, you need to edit the proj file and remove the BCL targets that were left behind.
trans-unit.target: If you see the error above after updating to the 0.17 or newer NuGet packages, you need to edit the proj file and remove the BCL targets that were left behind.

trans-unit.source: To do this:
trans-unit.target: To do this:

trans-unit.source: Right-click on your project in Solution Explorer and choose Unload Project.
trans-unit.target: Right-click on your project in Solution Explorer and choose Unload Project.

trans-unit.source: Right-click on project again and choose Edit yourProject.csproj
trans-unit.target: Right-click on project again and choose Edit yourProject.csproj

trans-unit.source: Go to the bottom of the project file and remove the BCL targets similar to: ``` <Import Project="..\packages\Microsoft.Bcl.Build.1.0.14\tools\Microsoft.Bcl.Build.targets" Condition="Exists('..\packages\Microsoft.Bcl.Build.1.0.14\tools\Microsoft.Bcl.Build.targets')" />
trans-unit.target: Go to the bottom of the project file and remove the BCL targets similar to: ``` <Import Project="..\packages\Microsoft.Bcl.Build.1.0.14\tools\Microsoft.Bcl.Build.targets" Condition="Exists('..\packages\Microsoft.Bcl.Build.1.0.14\tools\Microsoft.Bcl.Build.targets')" />

trans-unit.source: <Target Name="EnsureBclBuildImported" BeforeTargets="BeforeBuild" Condition="'$(BclBuildImported)' == ''">
trans-unit.target: <Target Name="EnsureBclBuildImported" BeforeTargets="BeforeBuild" Condition="'$(BclBuildImported)' == ''">

trans-unit.source: </Target> ```
trans-unit.target: </Target> ```

trans-unit.source: Save the file.
trans-unit.target: Save the file.

trans-unit.source: Right-click on the project and choose Reload yourProject.csproj
trans-unit.target: Right-click on the project and choose Reload yourProject.csproj

trans-unit.source: See the <linkText>release notes</linkText><title></title> for the SDK appropriate to your type of application.
trans-unit.target: See the <linkText>release notes</linkText><title></title> for the SDK appropriate to your type of application.

trans-unit.source: On the Overview page, click the Search tile to open Diagnostic Search.
trans-unit.target: On the Overview page, click the Search tile to open Diagnostic Search.

trans-unit.source: Data appears here first.
trans-unit.target: Data appears here first.

trans-unit.source: Click the Refresh button.
trans-unit.target: Click the Refresh button.

trans-unit.source: The blade refreshes itself periodically, but you can also do it manually.
trans-unit.target: The blade refreshes itself periodically, but you can also do it manually.

trans-unit.source: The refresh interval is longer for larger time ranges.
trans-unit.target: The refresh interval is longer for larger time ranges.

trans-unit.source: In the Microsoft Azure start board, look at the service status map.
trans-unit.target: In the Microsoft Azure start board, look at the service status map.

trans-unit.source: If there are some alert indications, wait until they have returned to OK and then close and re-open your Application Insights application blade.
trans-unit.target: If there are some alert indications, wait until they have returned to OK and then close and re-open your Application Insights application blade.

trans-unit.source: Check also <linkText>our status blog</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: Check also <linkText>our status blog</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: In your firewall, you might have to open TCP ports 80 and 443 for outgoing traffic to dc.services.visualstudio.com and f5.services.visualstudio.com.
trans-unit.target: In your firewall, you might have to open TCP ports 80 and 443 for outgoing traffic to dc.services.visualstudio.com and f5.services.visualstudio.com.

trans-unit.source: If you have to use a proxy to send out of your corporate network, set <linkText>defaultProxy</linkText><title></title> in Web.config
trans-unit.target: If you have to use a proxy to send out of your corporate network, set <linkText>defaultProxy</linkText><title></title> in Web.config

trans-unit.source: Windows Server 2008: Make sure you have installed the following updates: <linkText>KB2468871</linkText><title></title>, <linkText>KB2533523</linkText><title></title>, <linkText>KB2600217</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: Windows Server 2008: Make sure you have installed the following updates: <linkText>KB2468871</linkText><title></title>, <linkText>KB2533523</linkText><title></title>, <linkText>KB2600217</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: The data comes from scripts in the web pages.
trans-unit.target: The data comes from scripts in the web pages.

trans-unit.source: If you added Application Insights to an existing web project, <linkText>you have to add the scripts by hand[start]</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: If you added Application Insights to an existing web project, <linkText>you have to add the scripts by hand[start]</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Make sure Internet Explorer isn't displaying your site in Compatibility mode.
trans-unit.target: Make sure Internet Explorer isn't displaying your site in Compatibility mode.

trans-unit.source: Use the browser's debug feature (F12 on some browsers, then choose Network) to verify that data is being sent to dc.services.visualstudio.com.
trans-unit.target: Use the browser's debug feature (F12 on some browsers, then choose Network) to verify that data is being sent to dc.services.visualstudio.com.

trans-unit.source: Yes, you can monitor health and usage if your server can send data to the public internet.
trans-unit.target: Yes, you can monitor health and usage if your server can send data to the public internet.

trans-unit.source: But if you want to run web tests for your service, it must be accessible from the public internet on port 80.
trans-unit.target: But if you want to run web tests for your service, it must be accessible from the public internet on port 80.

trans-unit.source: You would have to arrange a proxy that can relay https POST calls to dc.services.visualstudio.com
trans-unit.target: You would have to arrange a proxy that can relay https POST calls to dc.services.visualstudio.com

trans-unit.source: Check the <linkText>status blog</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: Check the <linkText>status blog</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Have you hit your monthly quota of data points?
trans-unit.target: Have you hit your monthly quota of data points?

trans-unit.source: Open the Settings/Quota and Pricing to find out.
trans-unit.target: Open the Settings/Quota and Pricing to find out.

trans-unit.source: If so, you can upgrade your plan, or pay for additional capacity.
trans-unit.target: If so, you can upgrade your plan, or pay for additional capacity.

trans-unit.source: See the <linkText>pricing scheme</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: See the <linkText>pricing scheme</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Either:
trans-unit.target: Either:

trans-unit.source: Choose Browse, Application Insights, your project name.
trans-unit.target: Choose Browse, Application Insights, your project name.

trans-unit.source: If you don't have any projects there, you need to <linkText>add Application Insights to your web project in Visual Studio[start]</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: If you don't have any projects there, you need to <linkText>add Application Insights to your web project in Visual Studio[start]</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: In Visual Studio Solution Explorer, right-click your web project and choose Open Application Insights Portal.
trans-unit.target: In Visual Studio Solution Explorer, right-click your web project and choose Open Application Insights Portal.

trans-unit.source: In Solution Explorer, right-click ApplicationInsights.config and choose Update Application Insights.
trans-unit.target: In Solution Explorer, right-click ApplicationInsights.config and choose Update Application Insights.

trans-unit.source: You can send the data to an existing or new resource in Azure.
trans-unit.target: You can send the data to an existing or new resource in Azure.

trans-unit.source: The update wizard changes the instrumentation key in ApplicationInsights.config, which determines where the server SDK sends your data.
trans-unit.target: The update wizard changes the instrumentation key in ApplicationInsights.config, which determines where the server SDK sends your data.

trans-unit.source: Unless you deselect "Update all," it will also change the key where it appears in your web pages.
trans-unit.target: Unless you deselect "Update all," it will also change the key where it appears in your web pages.

trans-unit.source: No!
trans-unit.target: No!

trans-unit.source: It shows the status of the Azure service.
trans-unit.target: It shows the status of the Azure service.

trans-unit.source: To see your web test results, choose Browse > Application Insights > (your application) and then look at the web test results.
trans-unit.target: To see your web test results, choose Browse > Application Insights > (your application) and then look at the web test results.

trans-unit.source: You might be using <linkText>the older version of the Application Insights SDK</linkText><title></title>, which connects to the Visual Studio Online version.
trans-unit.target: You might be using <linkText>the older version of the Application Insights SDK</linkText><title></title>, which connects to the Visual Studio Online version.

trans-unit.source: The help pages you're looking at refer to <linkText>Application Insights for Microsoft Azure Preview[start]</linkText><title></title>, which comes already switched on in Visual Studio 2013 Update 3 and later.
trans-unit.target: The help pages you're looking at refer to <linkText>Application Insights for Microsoft Azure Preview[start]</linkText><title></title>, which comes already switched on in Visual Studio 2013 Update 3 and later.

trans-unit.source: Take a look at <linkText>Data Retention and Privacy[data]</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: Take a look at <linkText>Data Retention and Privacy[data]</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: We don't log POST data automatically, but you can use a TrackTrace call: put the data in the message parameter.
trans-unit.target: We don't log POST data automatically, but you can use a TrackTrace call: put the data in the message parameter.

trans-unit.source: This has a longer size limit than the limits on string properties, though you can't filter on it.
trans-unit.target: This has a longer size limit than the limits on string properties, though you can't filter on it.

trans-unit.source: See <linkText>Data Retention and Privacy[data]</linkText><title></title>.
